SEARCH
Package com.exam.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.exam.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/v1/user") @CrossOrigin("*") public class UserController extends Object
Controller class responsible for handling user-related operations and endpoints. This class acts as an interface between the front-end user interface and the backend services for user management, registration, and authentication.

  • Method Details

    • forgotUserName

      @PostMapping("/forgot_user_name") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> forgotUserName(@RequestParam("email") String email) throws Exception
      Initiates the process of recovering a forgotten username by sending an email to the user.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user requesting the forgotten username.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the operation's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the email is valid and the process starts successfully.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the provided email is not valid.
      Exception - If there's an issue with sending the email.

    • updateCreds

      @PutMapping("/update_credentials") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> updateCreds(@RequestBody User user) throws Exception
      Updates user credentials (password) and sends an email notification.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object containing the updated credentials.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the operation's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the user's credentials are updated and the email is sent successfully.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the provided username does not exist or the email doesn't match the user's email.
      Exception - If there's an issue with updating the credentials or sending the email.

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> createUser(@RequestBody User user)
      Creates a new user account, sends a confirmation email, and returns the registered user's details.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object representing the new user's details.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the registration's success, and the registered user's details. Returns 200 OK if the registration process is successful.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the provided email is not valid.
      Exception - If there's an issue with creating the user or sending the confirmation email.

    • resendConfirmationEmail

      @GetMapping("/resend_confirmation_email/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> resendConfirmationEmail(@RequestParam String email)
      Resends a confirmation email for account activation.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user requesting the email resend.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the email resend's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the email resend process starts successfully.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user with the given email is not found.

    • confirm

      @GetMapping(path="confirm") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> confirm(@RequestParam("token") String token)
      Confirms a user's registration using a confirmation token.
      Parameters:
      token - The confirmation token sent to the user's email.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the confirmation's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the confirmation process is successful.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the confirmation token is not found or has expired.

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> getUser(@PathVariable String username)
      Retrieves user details by username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the retrieval's success, and the retrieved user's details. Returns 200 OK if the user details are fetched successfully.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the user with the given username is not found.

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/delete_account") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> deleteUser(@RequestBody JwtRequest request)
      Deletes a user account and sends a deletion email notification.
      Parameters:
      request - The JwtRequest containing the username of the user to be deleted.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the deletion's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the user account is deleted successfully.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user with the given username is not found.

    • updatePassword

      @PutMapping("/forgot_password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> updatePassword(@RequestBody JwtRequest jwtRequest)
      Initiates the process of updating a forgotten password by sending an email to the user.
      Parameters:
      jwtRequest - The JwtRequest containing the username for password update.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the email sending's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the email is sent successfully.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If no user is found with the given username.

    • confirmPasswordEmail

      @GetMapping(path="confirm_password_email") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<CustomResponse> confirmPasswordEmail(@RequestParam("username") String username, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Confirms updating the password based on an email link.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user requesting password update.
      password - The new password.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a CustomResponse with a timestamp, a message indicating the password update's success, and null data. Returns 200 OK if the password is updated successfully.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If no user is found with the given username.
